items.title: A wobbly consumer is one reason investors shouldn’t be tempted to buy stock-market dips, says BofA
items.description: Investors should not be tempted back into the stock market until certain criteria are met, says BofA.

items.title: It’s time to start nibbling on Lowe’s and Williams-Sonoma’s stocks, analyst says
items.description: Patient investors will see the benefits of taking small purchases of these stocks.

items.title: Samuel Adams’s parent company points to gains in light beer as tastes shift from craft brews
items.description: Boston Beer Co. says that the company faces long-term challenges.

items.title: A cruel summer looms, but here’s why JPMorgan still expects a higher S&P 500 finish this year
items.description: The mood will improve later in 2025 as tariff angst eases, and focus turns to tax cuts and deregulation

items.title: Yes, this stock market is hard to predict — but it always is. Here’s what’s even harder.
items.description: It’s difficult to overcome “hindsight bias” — thinking that investing was easier than it really was.
